# llms.txt - AI Crawler Guidance for UCP Documentation
# https://docs.ucpstore.dev

> This is the unofficial documentation for the Universal Commerce Protocol (UCP).
> UCP is an open standard enabling seamless interoperability between AI agents,
> platforms, and businesses for autonomous commerce.

## About UCP

UCP (Universal Commerce Protocol) is the "HTTP of commerce" - a standardized
protocol that enables AI agents to autonomously browse, select, and purchase
products from any UCP-compatible business.

### Why UCP?

- **For AI Agents**: Autonomously browse, select, and purchase products
- **For Platforms**: Aggregate and expose commerce capabilities uniformly
- **For Businesses**: Become AI-ready without custom integrations

## Key Concepts

### Capabilities
Core commerce operations that every UCP-compatible system must support:
- `dev.ucp.shopping.checkout` - Create and complete purchase sessions
- `dev.ucp.common.identity_linking` - OAuth 2.0 user authorization
- `dev.ucp.shopping.order` - Order lifecycle management

### Extensions
Optional features that add specialized functionality:
- `dev.ucp.shopping.fulfillment` - Shipping and delivery
- `dev.ucp.shopping.discount` - Promotions and discounts
- `dev.ucp.common.ap2_mandate` - Cryptographic proofs
- `dev.ucp.common.buyer_consent` - Privacy compliance

### Transports
Communication protocols for different integration scenarios:
- REST - Direct HTTP API calls
- MCP - LLM tool integration
- A2A - Agent-to-agent communication
- Embedded - Hybrid iframe experiences

## Business Profile

Every UCP-compatible business publishes a profile at:
`/.well-known/ucp/business_profile.json`

This profile declares:
- Supported capabilities
- Available extensions
- Transport endpoints
- Payment handlers
